p: Asymptomatic infections have increasingly been recognized in family clusters with unknown index cases. The first cluster study comprised five family members from Anyang, China, who developed COVID-19 symptoms and tested positive by RT-PCR after acquiring the infection from the index case, an asymptomatic visitor from Wuhan who later tested positive ( Bai et al., 2020). Another study with five family members from Luzhou, China, described a patient who developed severe COVID-19 pneumonia after attending a family reunion. Apparently, he had acquired COVID-19 from an asymptomatic relative from Wuhan ( Ye et al., 2020).
